The city is also known for its beautiful patios, especially during the Patio Festival in May. Cordoba is well connected by train and plane to other major cities in Spain and Europe.

The Mezquita de Córdoba is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the most visited attractions in the city. The Alcazar de los Reyes Cristianos is a fortress that was used by Christian rulers after the Reconquista, and it houses a museum with art and artifacts from various periods. The Calleja de las Flores is a narrow, flower-filled street that is particularly beautiful in the spring. The Roman Bridge is an ancient bridge that crosses the Guadalquivir River and offers great views of the city.
